content.body:
If someone familiar with image lazy loading could take a minute to look at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/28077 and comment, that would be great. That change is adding this note:
> **Note:** Images that have `loading` set to `lazy` will never be loaded if their width or height is `0`, even if loading them would change that.
content.formatted_body:
If someone familiar with image lazy loading could take a minute to look at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/28077 and comment, that would be great. That change is adding this note:

Note: Images that have loading set to lazy will never be loaded if their width or height is 0, even if loading them would change that.

content.body: sideshowbarker: This isn't an answer, but IIRC it's based on IntersectionObserver, I wonder if that's spec'd to fire when elements have no area
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: This isn't an answer, but IIRC it's based on IntersectionObserver, I wonder if that's spec'd to fire when elements have no area
